intro: Tephroseris birubonensis, commonly known as the red-stemmed tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and small, clustered white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Tephroseris birubonensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
